summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are monitored for exposure levels in various public transportation microenvironments in Hong Kong. They are part of a group of compounds (BTEX) associated with vehicular emissions, indicating a shared relevance in studies of air quality and pollution exposure. However, the context does not detail their specific interactions or comparative significance beyond their inclusion in the same category of pollutants.
